solution_line_template: First, you need to set up the problem with the information given. The cost of the skirts and art supplies must equal ${total_spent}<<{total_spent}={total_spent}>>{total_spent}.
To solve the equation, subtract {art_supplies_cost} from both sides, to give you the new equation: {num_skirts}x = {remaining_cost}.
Solve for x by dividing both sides of the equation by {num_skirts}, {num_skirts}x/{num_skirts} = {remaining_cost}/{num_skirts} gives you x = {cost_per_skirt}.
